comment: She is not the worst prof, she offer extra credit, fixes incorrect questions, gives the point back. However, she is not the best for an online class, I found it easier to contact her through office hours. This class you need to take notes to pass as there is a lot of content, I suggest notes with pictures as this helped me as exams are open note.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: I emailed her, texted her (she said to even though I thought it was weird), and then emailed her again and never heard back from her on my topic for my paper so I just had to pick a topic myself. Almost something wrong every week and lots of stuff to work on for the week. Week after spring break, 20 vids, reading, a quiz, and a 3 part test. So bad!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: She is a very sweet lady, but she is unorganized and does not get back to you by email. I have asked her to do some quiz corrections because some things are keyed wrong on the keys, and I have not seen those changes. It is hard to determine what content is on a quiz when everything is just a clutter of guessing.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I'm currently taking her right now for ARH2850, and this is the most disorganized and passive aggressive teacher I have ever taken. Her lectures are unhelpful, and she takes literal WEEKS to get back to you. She sucks and if you have the option to not take her, don't take her.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Constantly off-topic and rambles about irrelevant topics, grades extremely tough and antagonizes you passive aggressively in the grading notes too. The presentations she posts for studying are useless, only containing images of paintings that she then rambles over in class. Requires absurd amounts of reading. Disorganized and falls behind. RUN
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Dr. McClintock is very nice and knowledgeable about all things art history. She is disorganized and grades late but always apologized for mistakes and accepted and applied feedback. She was also easy to reach outside of class. I would definitely take her again.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Caring

comment: The worst art history teacher, but as a person she is very nice. Always lost track of time, grades, assignments. the lack of presence for the class really unmotivated you from doing well. She would always go off-topic which led for the class to be behind. Never gave out updates or communicated with the class. Awful way of teaching.

When you go back to look at your quiz results, instead of the right answers you find weird passive aggressive remarks under your wrong answers. She can't even spell them right! I don't understand how I'm supposed to learn anything from my mistakes with this system, and frankly it is rude, petty, and unprofessional.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: If there's any other professor that you could take instead of her then do yourself a favor and do so. The sheer amount of reading and lectures that this teacher requires for a 4 WEEK ONLY course is nothing less than a joke. She's clearly crunching up a whole semester worth of work into these 4 weeks. Avoid this class!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: This teacher is an absolute mess. I am stressing real bad already because the video lectures aren't exactly the same as the textbook. She rambles about stuff that is so irrelevant and has no correlation with textbook. What"s crazy is that she expect us to read 71 pages and then watch 34 lecture videos... 34!! All of this for just week 1. Dont take.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I don't recommend Professor McClintock at all. She's very disorganized, to the point where sometimes she wouldn't even know what chapter we were on. She is a very harsh grader on the exams, I've personally never gotten higher than an 82. Not only that, but it takes a very long time to get them graded. Only upside is there is a lot of extra credit.
rating_tags: Tough grader--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. McClintok is the WORST professor I've ever had. She is VERY disorganized has been behind on getting lectures and quizzes out all semester, directions for assignments are unclear and  overly complicated. Me and other students have emailed and met with the director of the art department multiple times and nothing has changed. DO NOT TAKE!
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: If you are interested in Art history I would definitely recommend her. The course is not easy, but she gives great feedback and the quizzes prepare you greatly for the exams. Her grading criteria is clear, and she also allows extra credit per every exam, so if you read the textbook and watch the lectures, you'll do fine!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: 20 lectures a week sometimes she never grades things and always makes mistakes in the course and sends out an email calling it an"oops" she is so unorganized and uses lectures from 7 years ago when the textbook u use was printed in 2021. Her lectures never line up with the book and ur quizzes r on completely different info. Pls never take her. run
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: This class was a joke. She never followed her own deadlines, couldn't focus enough to get through a lecture, AND was a harsh grader on top of that. Disrespects our time and other classes' time. She does not answer questions, and will only get sidetracked by talking about herself. Required us to purchase a book we never once touched. Horrible class
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things

comment: She is such a tough grader for written parts on tests and gives less than an hour for multiple questions that she expects so much information for. Almost 20 pages of reading from the textbook and multiple lecture videos every week with a quiz at the end of it. Do not take her!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Please do not take this course. VERY RUDE!! The entire class struggled. There are 20 pages to read from the textbook each week with a quiz, which need extremely precise notes to pass. The exams are very hard. You must have strong notes to pass the written portion. The entire class was so so stressful. Would not take again!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Mcclintock was a very nice professor but she had a difficult time staying on topic, getting grades back at a timely manner, and staying true to her word. Everything was disorganized and confusing, to the point where our whole class was struggling by the end of the semester. Would not take her again
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Dr. McClintock did not give clear instruction of her expectations in the course, and had a hard time staying on topic during class periods. She was confusing, hard to follow, and a tough grader. The professor did not grade any of our assignments (except one paper) before the day of our final exam, and didn't show up for the test.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Test heavy--So many papers

comment: I took History of Animation and it was miserable. Her lectures and powerpoints are jumbled and confusing like other reviews said. Our final exam was delayed last-minute three times, and she failed to email us on these changes a few times. It's been over a week past our original final date and she's still making changes. Worst prof I've ever had.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I've taken Prof. McClintock for a few classes and they are without a doubt are the most difficult (even in comparison to higher level courses) I've had in terms of workload & the amount of preparation you have to do for tests. She's a kind lady, but her tendency to ramble on during lectures makes them confusing and hard to follow.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Caring--Tough grader

comment: I'm not gonna lie, she is a very tough teacher; you won't pass without that textbook and without doing the weekly lectures. She does give extra credit on every test and she answers emails pretty quickly. My advice: watch the lecture videos while reading the textbook so you can go along with her and jot down notes. Again, she's tough but I learned.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I passed every test with an average of B and A.... yet I end the semester with a C?? Because of one paper. Was extremely rude on the feedback. Very disrespectful and disorganized. Not nice
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Took Professor McClintock for ARH2850 online. Her tests are the standard read the textbook and answer multiple choice. However she has an essay part on her tests, which she grades strictly on. She only gives a hour for those multi-paragraph questions. Way too excessive for a pre-req class. Do not recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: McClintock is a nice person. She means well but is disorganized. Consequently, this leads to the class being more difficult than it needs to be.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Do not take this professor. I read her ratings thinking she was nice. Don't be dumb like I was. She rants in lecture over things that won't be on test or quiz. Don't watch lecture they will just confuse you. I just read the book and taught myself. Even after reading and knowing information she twist words on questions and gives you no time on test
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She acts like a know it all when the art is actually very easy and intresting to learn, however she makes the class difficult by not being truthful what will be on test and quizzes. She also gives you no time and makes it feel like your back in third grade taking a multiplication times table test. horrible professor ever. Just not a nice person.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: by far the worst professor I have ever had. To the people who said she was sweet and nice, thanks for lying. This woman is rude. Not only is she extremly unorginized but gives no time on quizzes and test. Before our first exam she showed us examples of her catching kids cheating. Oh and she talks in this annoying baby voice in lecture
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor McClintock is an wonderful woman, and shes so passionate about the subject. HOWEVER, she is the most unorganized professor Ive ever had. She DESPERATELY needs an assistant, or better time management. Lectures are hard to follow and the different versions of the same PowerPoint will make your head spin. Truly a shame for how nice she is.

Before I say anything negative, let me first say how sweet/kind this woman is. She's very passionate about graphic design & I wish her the absolute best. HOWEVER, I will never take her again. Disorganized, constant excuses, impossible to listen to in lectures, tests that don't reflect the study guides, etc. Rated 3 only because of how nice she is.

She is clearly passionate about art history, but she goes off on so many tangents that it becomes a challenge to follow along. I figured I would just read the textbook instead of listen to her rambling, but I nearly failed the first exam, so I learned the hard way that you have to fight through the boredom if you want to be pass her (HARD) exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She's enthusiastic about this class. She is an easy grader on test. I got an A, and I only gotten an A one other time at KSU. I think I got an A plus. She really wants to help me in her class. She gave 10 percent extra credit on one test.  She takes interest in her students. She is disorganized, but I think it's worth taking her!
rating_tags: Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: McClintock is a great professor and knows what she is talking about. Her tests were pretty hard but taking the practice quizzes makes a huge difference in your grade. You have to visit the High Museum so be prepared to dish out some money. Her grading is very clear and as long as you do all the quizzes and practice quizzes the tests should be easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: (Online) this was the hardest class I've ever took. Math, science, pretty much any other subject was easier. I absolutely loved the content, but the amount of work she expected you to learn was just overwhelming. The questions she asks are so confusing. teaching style was just not for me so I ended up dropping. First and only class I had to drop.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I thought it would be cool to take an art history class as an elective. The class was ANYTHING but fun. She threw so much information at you, that I did better on quizzes when I didn't listen to the lectures. The amount of lectures and text book reading expected was insane! Worst class I have ever taken. Awful professor. Do NOT take this class!!!!!

Didn't know what she was talking about half the time. Felt like I couldn't listen to her because she was going to give me the wrong information. Bad teacher, not organized and isn't clear on assignment.  Good Luck if you decide to take her.

Took this class online. Each unit has several video lectures. You should read the book as well. One High Museum essay is required, along with quizzes for each unit and 3 tests (including final). She's very helpful and it's obvious she wants her students to succeed.

She definitely knows what she is talking about and is passionate about art history. But you won't pass if you don't study and show up to class. The test are pretty hard, but as long as you study the material, you'll get an A or B.

3 Tests (memorize about 90 works of art and tested on almost all of them; title, date, author, context, style, iconography, and significance). 1 paper (2-3 pages). About 18 online quizzes, but she only takes 15 for a grade. Lots of extra credit opportunities. She usually messes up on the online quizzes, but as long as you tell her she will fix it.

She likes to ramble on about the artist lives and things that wont be on the test for a majority of the time and then stuff a bit of information about the art in in the last minute. I couldn't focus in her class. She's really nice though so I'm going to try to take it again online. Maybe I'll do better without her distracting me.

Such a nice person, but her exams are hell. She expects her students to have an almost professional level of understanding for an overwhelming amount of material that we are only given weeks to learn. I had to do extra-curricular reading and grind for countless hours to pull a B in this class. WAY too extreme for an entry level  class.

I made a big mistake to sign for her class. NEVER EVER take her again. Disorganized person, aspect a lot from student, never gives the rezults from the tests on time, hard tests, I don't like the way of her greading!!! Horible.....

She is a very nice person, but makes Art History a complete nightmare.  She expects you to basically do a critique on all the studied art works. There are hundreds of them to memorize. She also is VERY unorganized. TEST 1 was given back 3 weeks later. Try to avoid her. I had to withdraw from the class because her style of teaching doesn't suit me.

She really is sweet but what she wants from her students is not realistic. She wants all of her students to learn in depth ALL of the materials, not memorize them. That's fine, but not everyone is an art hist major, these courses are required for the majority of us. Everyone I know in the class is struggling and will most likely get a C.

I took her for both AH 2750 & 2850 - terribly hard for a 2000 level course. This was just an elective for me. Didn't really understand what she wanted on her test. Tried scheduling numerous appointments with her, which she kept cancelling. Overall - very tough with too much information to remember.

This professor is awesome! She is quite consistant; lectures on  PowerPoints everyday.The tests are what you cover in class plus stuff from the text. You have to read the book and review power points if you want an A in the class. However if you're looking for an easy class just to fill your schedule, this is not it

She is a really sweet lady. She really wants everyone to do well and she knows a lot about art and does her best to make students enjoy it. It does take awhile for her to give tests back, but every professor has their pros and cons. She is still a really good teacher!

good professor, knows a lot about her art. but completely disorganized, changed our test format each test so we didn't know what to expect. Test were straight forward (if you studied and paid attention), memorization quizzes each with bout 15 artworks. would talk about one picture half the class which got kinda boring use a computer to take notes.

& 2780. She knows alot about art but her disorganization really caused alot of confusion for the class and therefore let an imppact on our grades.  if u cannot stand disorganization then dont take her but shes pretty cool just dont take 2 of her ARH courses at the same time bc all the quizzzes & tests are on the same day which was hard!!

I took dr. McClintock for renaissance art history on italy study abroad. she was incredibly sympathetic to the fact that we were too busy enjoying Italy to work like we do in the fall. She's very passionate about art and she's a sweetheart. take her if you love art.

She is really great. Very helpful. Really excited about her subjects. You have to study a lot in her classes but she gives a lot of extra credit. Last semester I got a 60 on my first exam and still managed to make an A at the end. I had her twice already and I will still take her again next semester :)You need to study a lot but the teacher is grea

Her class was pretty easy and she's nice, but she is so scatter brained. She can't keep her train of thought for too long, not to mention really boring. I personally wouldn't take any of her classes again.
Nice women, but very unorganized, I did not know the majority of my grades going into the final. This class should be an easy A but is not.

She is a sweet woman, but a real space cadet. But if you can overlook her dizziness, then you would see that she is a very knowledgable  and intelligent art historian.  If you want a thorough understanding of art, take this teacher.
